title: Which famous guitarists would you consider bad players? - Quora

response.answer_text: That’s a hard question to field because it’s unclear what criteria for a “bad” player to be. If it’s just a lack of skill, even the “worst” famous players have to have at least a fundamental knowledge of chords and scales and riffs. Some have more knowledge of that stuff than others but that doesn’t make them “bad” players. For example Steve Vai certainly has far more musical knowledge and skill than The Edge but that doesn’t make Edge a bad player. Someone like Bob Dylan or Keith Richards or Tom Petty aren’t fast or technical and never take memorable solos but their songwriting abilities on guitar are far beyond many who can play much faster and more accurately. Jimmy Page is one of the best of all time yet he’s considered to be a “sloppy” player. I guess my point here is that “bad” is a loaded term that can indicate deficiencies in any of a number of skills as a guitarist but you’d be hard pressed to find a guitarist who’s achieved fame with deficiencies in ALL areas of guitar playing. I can’t think of a famous guitarist who lacks musical knowledge, accuracy, speed, rhythm playing, lead playing, songwriting abilities, a knack for riffs, feeling in their playing all at the same time.

I am going down the same road as Anders on this one. None of them are bad players because they were good enough to get there and sell some records. Is Eric Clapton boring to watch? Hell yes he is but he’s also Eric Clapton which means he is definitely not a bad player. Is Jimmy Page sloppy? Hell yes he is but he’s also Jimmy f$@&ing Page!!! He’s always played like he was drunk (wait a minute, hmmmmm). All kinds of hair bands come to mind for me, but so what? They’re retired and I’m not.
